strapiPost.title: West Side Story
strapiPost.content:
To address the growing student population on the west side of town, the Fayetteville School Board recently approved the construction of a new middle school.

  • Last year, the school board voted to approve the purchase of 23 acres on Rupple Road for $1.8 million to secure a spot for what at the time was either going to be an elementary or middle school.

  • After rezoning the property in January, the school board unanimously approved the development of a middle school yesterday. This school will create some elbow room for the student population at Owl Creek School.

  • The middle school is set to open August of 2023
